Functional dominance in the central dogma of tumor mitochondrial genetics

No authors listed. Nat Genet. 2025.

PubMed Disclaimer

References

    1. Stewart, J. B. & Chinnery, P. F. The dynamics of mitochondrial DNA heteroplasmy: implications for human health and disease. Nat. Rev. Genet. 16, 530–542 (2015). A review article presenting the role of heteroplasmy in mitochondrial disease. - DOI - PubMed
    1. Boscenco, S., Cumming, E. M., Kim, M., Lareau, C. & Reznik, E. Single-cell technologies for studying the evolution and function of mitochondrial DNA heteroplasmy in cancer. Annu. Rev. Cancer Biol. 9, 161–180 (2025). A review article that expands on a functional role for somatic mtDNA mutations in cancer. - DOI
    1. Gorman, G. S. et al. Mitochondrial diseases. Nat. Rev. Dis. Primers 2, 16080 (2016). A review article that explains the threshold effect in hereditary mitochondrial disease. - DOI - PubMed
    1. Fu, Y. et al. Engineering mtDNA deletions by reconstituting end joining in human mitochondria. Cell 188, 2778–2793.e21 (2025). A recent article that highlights the threshold effects observed in engineered models of mtDNA deletion. - DOI - PubMed
    1. Mahmood, M. et al. Mitochondrial DNA mutations drive aerobic glycolysis to enhance checkpoint blockade response in melanoma. Nat. Cancer 5, 659–672 (2024). This article demonstrates the functional and therapeutic relevance of coding-region mtDNA mutations in melanoma. - DOI - PubMed - PMC
